block.p: A selective listing of state, county and local government events across Connecticut this week. (All dates and times subject to confirmation.) Items should be submitted by mail at least three weeks in advance to the Connecticut Op-Ed Page, The New York Times, 229 West 43rd Street, New York, N.Y. 10036, or by e-mail to ctcivic@nytimes.com.
State of Connecticut

Hartford Connecticut Commission on Human Rights and Opportunities. Thursday at 2 p.m. 21 Grand Street. (860) 541-3400. Hartford Hearing on appeal of a site remediation order. Monday and Tuesday at 9 a.m. Connecticut Department of Environmental Protection Headquarters, 79 Elm Street. (860) 424-3037. Hartford Underground Storage Tank Petroleum Clean-Up Account Review Board. Tuesday at 1:30 p.m. Connecticut Department of Environmental Protection Headquarters, 79 Elm Street. (860) 424-3370. Hartford State Implementation Plan Revision Advisory Committee. Thursday at 9 a.m. Connecticut Department of Environmental Protection Headquarters, 79 Elm Street. (860) 424-3027. Hartford Harborside Associates status conference. Thursday at 2 p.m. Connecticut Department of Environmental Protection Headquarters, 79 Elm Street. (860) 424-3037. Hartford Connecticut Siting Council hearing on the Connecticut forecast of electric loads and resources. Tuesday at 10 a.m. and 7 p.m. Legislative Office Building, 300 Capitol Avenue. (860) 827-2935. Hartford Full commission. Wednesday at 9 a.m. State Elections Enforcement Commission, 20 Trinity Street. (860) 566-1776. Montville MetroCast Communications public hearing. Thursday at 3 p.m. and 7 p.m. Montville Town Hall, 310 Norwich-New London Turnpike. (860) 827-2935.
Fairfield County

Bethel Bethel High School Building Committee. Thursday at 7 p.m. Clifford J. Hurgin Municipal Center, 1 School Street. (203) 794-8501. Danbury Commission on Persons With Disabilities. Tuesday at 6:30 p.m. Danbury City Hall, 155 Deer Hill Avenue. (203) 797-4500. Newtown Charter Revision Commission. Tuesday at 7 p.m. Newtown Town Hall South, 3 Main Street. (203) 426-6470. Redding Historic Properties Committee. Monday at 8:30 a.m. Redding Town Hall, 100 Hill Road. (203) 938-2002. Trumbull Board of Finance. Thursday at 7:30 p.m. Trumbull Town Hall, 5866 Main Street. (203) 452-5000.
Hartford County

Avon Water Pollution Control Authority. Thursday at 5 p.m. Avon Town Hall, 60 West Main Street. (860) 409-4300. Plainville Veterans Council. Monday at 7 p.m. Plainville Municipal Center, 1 Central Square. (860) 793-0221.
Litchfield County

Barkhamsted Board of Selectmen. Tuesday at 7 p.m. Barkhamsted Town Hall, 67 Ripley Hill Road. (860) 379-8285. Colebrook Planning and Zoning Commission. Monday at 7 p.m. Colebrook Town Hall, Colebrook Center. (860) 379-3359. Plymouth Planning and Zoning Commission. Thursday at 7 p.m. Plymouth Town Hall, 80 Main Street. (860) 585-4001. Roxbury Conservation Commission. Wednesday at 7 p.m. Roxbury Town Hall, 29 North Street. (860) 354-9938. Salisbury Recreation Committee. Tuesday at 8 p.m. Salisbury Town Hall, 27 Main Street. (860) 435-5182. Washington Inland Wetlands Commission. Wednesday at 7 p.m. Washington Town Hall, 2 Bryan Plaza. (860) 868-2259. Woodbury Board of Selectman. Thursday at 7:30 p.m. Shove Building, 281 Main Street South. (203) 263-2144.
Middlesex County

Chester Economic Development Commission. Monday at 7:15 p.m. Chester Town Hall, 203 Middlesex Avenue. (860) 526-0013. Portland Planning and Zoning Commission. Thursday at 7 p.m. Portland Town Hall, 33 East Main Street. (860) 342-6715.
New Haven County

Cheshire Public Safety Committee. Wednesday at 7:15 p.m. Cheshire Town Hall, 84 South Main Street. (203) 271-6660. Madison Economic Development Commission. Thursday at 7:30 p.m. Madison Town Campus, 8 Campus Drive. (203) 245-5672.
New London County

Lebanon Rails to Trails Committee. Monday at 6:30 p.m. Lebanon Town Hall, 579 Exeter Road. (860) 642-7319. Waterford Conservation Commission. Thursday at 7 p.m. Waterford Town Hall, 15 Rope Ferry Road. (860) 442-0553.
Tolland County

Andover Board of Education. Wednesday at 7 p.m. Andover Elementary School, 35 School Road. (860) 742-7305. Tolland Conservation Commission. Thursday at 7 p.m. Hicks Memorial Municipal Building, 21 Tolland Green. (860) 871-3600.
Windham County

Danielson Plan of Conservation and Development. Thursday at 7 p.m. Killingly Town Hall, 172 Main Street. (860) 779-5300. Pomfret Conservation Commission. Thursday at 7 p.m. Pomfret Town Hall, 5 Haven Road. (860) 974-0343.
